item.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1046, H. Res. 767 is laid on the table.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 161.

Provides that the requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House is waived with respect to any resolution reported on the legislative day of April 6, 2006, providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 376) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2007 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2008 through 2011.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-406, by Mr. Putnam.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-406, by Mr. Putnam.

summary.text: Waives a specified requirement of rule XIII to provide for consideration of H.Con.Res. 376 (establishing the congressional budget for FY2007 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for FY2008-FY2011).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Waives a specified requirement of rule XIII to provide for consideration of H.Con.Res. 376 (establishing the congressional budget for FY2007 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for FY2008-FY2011).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
